title: what this is similar to?
content:
You remember some logo similar to this?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo\_\_ac.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174842/http:/typophile.com/files/logo__ac.jpg) | 31.58 KB |
author: mar_raujo

comments.content:
Reminded me a bit of the Richie Brothers logo. In which the the 'rb" resembles a tractor (they sell/auction farm equipment).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174842im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Ritchie-Bros_5496.-Logo1.jpg)

I've heard that style referred to as a "ribbon" look, with shadows where pieces cross.

Of course a real ribbon can't be bent into a shape like that, but there is a resemblance. QVC (a tv shopping network) uses a similar effect with their Q, and I'm sure there are many other examples.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174842im_/http:/typophile.com/files/qvc2_5392.jpg)

This style of the logos is based Origami graphical structure mimic of folded paper.

Here you can find some examples. [http://designmodo.com/origami-logo/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174842/http:/designmodo.com/origami-logo/ "http://designmodo.com/origami-logo/")
